gpt-config.title: GPT Settings & API Test
gpt-config.model-fetch-error: API Key or organization not configured correctly, language models are not available.
gpt-config.stats-message:
The platform has used a total of {{all}} Tokens.
Of which {{week}} was this week and {{day}} Tokens this day.
The last usage was on {{date}}.
gpt-config.boxplot-message: The median {{median}} {{type}} per request was consumed, with 50% of the data between {{lower}} tokens and {{upper}} Tokens. Of {{count}} Requests, {{lowerStray}} below and {{upperStray}} above are torn out.
gpt-config.api-key-and-model-required: * The API key and language model is required for the API to be fundamentally supported. 'text-davinci-003' (language model) currently provides the best results.
gpt-config.temperature-and-top-p-exclusive: * Either the temperature or the nucleus sampling should be adjusted. However, not both.
gpt-config.temperature-determinism: ** Even if the value is 0, other responses can be generated!
gpt-config.max-tokens-cap: * The maximum tokens depend on the language model, the newest ones can generate 4096 while the old ones can only generate 2048 tokens.
gpt-config.penalty-info: * Penalties from 0.1 to 1.0 suppress similar topics / tokens. Values above 1 suppress similar tokens almost completely, but the quality suffers.
gpt-config.help-general: The GPT API provides an artificial intelligence that performs text completion. In doing so, the AI answers classification, knowledge, and other questions. The AI has one input and provides at least one output.
gpt-config.help-api-key: The API key assigns the requests to an account. So consumption and costs can be calculated and displayed in the OpenAI account
gpt-config.help-organization: Organization is an optional way to have consumption billed through an organization instead of directly through your own OpenAI account.
gpt-config.help-model: The language model decides how certain tasks are best solved. Furthermore, it gives you the possibility to choose less expensive models.
gpt-config.help-max-tokens: The maximum number of tokens to use to generate *all* outputs. The input will be omitted.
gpt-config.help-temperature: The temperature allows setting whether high risk is allowed or almost deterministic outputs are desired. 1 means high risk, 0 means almost no risk.
gpt-config.help-top-percentage: Restricts the tokens so that only the tokens with the top probabilities are selected. If the value is 0.1, the top 10% will be selected.
gpt-config.help-logprobs: Outputs all tokens that were most likely as well as the selected ones. However, the number of most probable is limited to 5.
gpt-config.help-echo: The input is appended as the preceding text of each output.
gpt-config.help-stop: Stop words are an additional possibility to limit inputs. Furthermore, they can be used as structuring elements during input.
gpt-config.help-presence-penalty: Suppresses or increases the repetition of tokens. Higher values promote new themes.
gpt-config.help-frequency-penalty: Suppresses or strengthens the repetition of tokens. Higher values suppress similar sentence positions.
gpt-config.help-logit-bias: Changes the probabilities for tokens. Values from -1 to 1 decrease or increase the probability, while -100 and 100 banish the tokens or select them exclusively if they occur.
gpt-config.help-trial-code: Code for activating the global API for rooms.

gpt-chat.input-forbidden: Input forbidden, please check the GPT API settings.
gpt-chat.no-api-setup: The API key or language model was not set.

text-davinci-003.value:
You are in the chat room called "English" and the topic is poetry. Explain the following question at the level of an elementary school student.
Student: What are haikus?
You:

You are in the chat room called "History" and the topic is the golden twenties. Explain the following question at the level of a high school student.
Student: What does the Dawes Plan say?
You:

You are in the chat room called "Algorithms and Data Structures" and the topic is simple data structures. Explain at the level of a 2nd semester computer science student the following question.
Student: Is there a performance gain when you combine a linked list and an array list? Surely it would be conceivable to link arrays, or am I wrong there?
You:

code-davinci-002.value:
<|endoftext|>/* I start with a blank HTML page, and incrementally modify it via <script> injection. Written for Chrome. */
/* Command: Add "Hello World", by adding an HTML DOM node */
var helloWorld = document.createElement('div');
helloWorld.innerHTML = 'Hello World';
document.body.appendChild(helloWorld);
/* Command: Clear the page. */
while (document.body.firstChild) {
  document.body.removeChild(document.body.firstChild);
}

/* Command: Display this image of a cat: https://bit.ly/3fsc0rH */

davinci-instruct-beta:2.0.0.value: The subject is demotivating. Do you have any tricks to cheer up and get more active?

gpt-chat.use-case-tooltip: Selecting a specific use case for better answers.
gpt-chat.use-case-tooltip-answer-questions: Very effective when given good questions or tasks (e.g. translation and summary). Usually provides the best text answers.
gpt-chat.use-case-tooltip-code: Very good at code understanding and generation. Has a wider context than language models.
gpt-chat.use-case-tooltip-chat: Effective for open-ended questions where follow-up questions are needed. Does not provide as accurate results as answering questions.
